function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Seed each simulation by adjusting observed I t on the first day using country-specific estimates of case detection rates.","Impact":"Underestimation of the initial number of infections leading to inaccurate projections of total cumulative cases.","Mitigation":"Use multiple sources of data to estimate initial infections and consider a range of case detection rates for more accurate projections.","Technologies":"Data analysis and statistical modeling to estimate initial infections and case detection rates.","People":"Researchers, statisticians, and public health officials","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies"},{"Description":"Assuming an infection-fatality ratio of 0.75% without accounting for asymptomatic infections.","Impact":"Failure to consider asymptomatic infections may lead to underestimation of total infections and inaccurate projections of disease spread.","Mitigation":"Account for asymptomatic infections and vary the infection-fatality ratio in simulations to consider a range of possibilities.","Technologies":"Statistical modeling and simulation tools that allow for variations in infection-fatality ratio.","People":"Epidemiologists, statisticians, and public health researchers","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions"},{"Description":"Estimating uncertainty by resampling from the estimated variance-covariance matrix of all regression parameters.","Impact":"Inaccurate estimation of uncertainty leading to unreliable projections and risk assessments.","Mitigation":"Use alternative methods such as bootstrapping and sensitivity analysis to assess uncertainty and validate projections.","Technologies":"Statistical tools for sensitivity analysis and validation of regression parameters.","People":"Statisticians, data scientists, and researchers","Owner":"Research institutions, data analysis teams"}]}
